summary:
My personal goal is to achieve a more sustainable society that can harmonize with its environment.
My dream is to achieve this through working in international, trans-disciplinary teams all over the world.                    

I believe in improving each other every day thriving on teamwork because it often allows me to gain new insights. I think that to improve sustainability around the world the application of the knowledge we have needs to be improved. I aspire to meet that demand by researching and communicating recommendations on environmental problems in the places where this is most needed.

education.field_of_study: Future Planet Studies majoring in Geological and Earth Sciences/Geosciences

company.name: Institute for Biodiversity and Ecosystem Dynamics - University of Amsterdam

profile_positions.company: Institute for Biodiversity and Ecosystem Dynamics - University of Amsterdam
profile_positions.description:
As an assistant, I helped with tutorials and fieldwork for the following courses: 

- Climate Change and Sea Level Rise:
This course teaches the functioning of the climate system and climate changes and the underlying physical basis. Teaching students the skills to use that knowledge to model climate changes on earth of varying temporal resolution (and it's effects on sea level). Further emphasis is put upon developing the students ability to identify and model causal relationships on a abstract level to create functional dynamic models. 

- World Food and Ecosystems:
This course aims to explain how biotic, abiotic and anthropogenic processes influence patterns in ecosystems and food production systems, how they have evolved in the past and how they might evolve in the future. Students are taught to analyze patterns/processes and their interactions determining world food and ecosystems using large spatial datasets with coding concepts (R, Google Earth Engine) seen during the tutorials to new problems on the nexus of food-and ecosystems.

Responsibilities:
- Explaining computational and physics assignments. 
- Providing instructions. 
- Answering questions on lecture material and individual assignments.
- Reviewing assignments/exams.
profile_positions.title: Teaching and research assistant

profile_positions.description:
During my internship at the VR Learning Lab under supervision of the Knowledge Technology and Innovation (KTI) group of Wageningen I got the freedom to develop a VR experience dubbed Ecogenesis VR. The goal is to make an experience of untouched nature more accessible, ultimately aiming to elicit an intrinsic motivation to protect nature and to make the first steps towards digitally conserving our planet's most diverse ecosystems in a pristine state for future generations. We aim to do so with the production of an interactive 360° VR-experience based on real-world objects captured with 3D-scanning, an effort which is part of a larger vision encompassing scientific studies to understand these ecosystems and the development of documentaries to shine a light upon the people who depend on these ecosystems.

During my internship I have put together a team to develop Ecogenesis VR. In that time we have written a production plan, made a budget, were one of the finalists for the WWF Student INNO challenge, applied for several academic and artistic funds and built up a network in the creative VR industry. In addition to writing a scientific report on the possible benefits of using VR in science communication, with a particular focus on conservation science. 

Responsibilities:
• 3D modelling of remote and in situ sensing data. 
• Coding in UnrealEngine4
• Development of Human Machine Interfaces (HMI) for Virtual Reality (VR)
• Project management
• Talent Acquisition
• Fundraising
• Academic reporting
profile_positions.title: Creative Director

profile_positions.description:
As in intern at Wageningen Marine Research (WMR) I operated within the Resilience Restoration of Nature and Society in the Caribbean Netherlands (RESCC2N) project. This project contributes to halting the decline of the coral reefs in the Caribbean Netherlands, improving the dependent ecosystem services and ensuring capacity building on the islands. An extensive monitoring network is being set up together with island organizations and companies to better keep a finger on the pulse of marine nature, to support nature policy and prevent negative effects, to optimize coral recovery and to build capacity on site. All using the latest techniques in remote sensing, underwater equipment, genetics, chemistry and machine learning. 

My internship at WMR was also part of the MSc thesis I wrote for the study Aquaculture and Marine Resource Management: "Dynamics of the Deep: The influence of spatial heterogeneity of water quality on dominant benthic groups on Bonaire.". Within the RESC2N project I was responsible for the Coral surveys with ROV and qater quality measurements. But I also designed my own experiments, helped with lab work, conducted data analysis and assisted with data processing. Furthermore, I have presented the results of my research at the International Coral Reef Symposium (ICRS) 2022 in Bremen.

Responsibilities:
•  Coral reef surveys with a remote operated underwater vehicle (ROV)
• Water quality sampling
• Statistical analysis
• Public speaking
profile_positions.title: Graduate Student Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Sailing for Impact is a project where a team of ambitious master students from 
different disciplines and universities function as a sailing think tank tackling themes 
around the Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) in post-corona Europe.

Responsibilities:
• Organize interdisciplinary workshops for doctors, master students and 
PhD cannidates.
• Innovate and safeguard our interdisciplinary collaborations internally and 
externally.
• Fundraising, team management and leadership skills were regularly 
required to secure the progression of the project.
profile_positions.title: Head research team/Crewmember
